A train is a form of rail transport consisting of a series of connected vehicles that generally run along a railroad track to transport cargo or passengers.
A model railway layout is a miniature replica of a real railway system.
A model railway is a miniature representation of a railway system. Model railways are built to different scales. The most popular being HO scale, OO scale, and N scale.

Trains are often on rails.
A model railway layout or model railroad layout is the physical representation of a railway system and is a miniature model of the real thing.
A model train is a model of a train that is scaled down to a smaller size.

A railway track or railroad track is a set of two parallel rails, typically anchored perpendicular to beams, called sleepers, or ties, which are laid on the ground to maintain a consistent distance apart.
The train is sitting on a track.
A track or rail is a structure consisting of a pair of parallel linear rail elements (rails) for the movement of trains.
The train is sitting on tracks.

The track on a railway or railroad, also known as the permanent way, is the structure consisting of the rails, fasteners, railroad ties (sleepers, British English) and ballast (or slab track), plus the underlying subgrade.

A railroad track or railway track is a set of two parallel steel rails, which are anchored perpendicular to beams of timber, concrete or steel to maintain a consistent distance apart, or gauge. The rails and perpendicular beams are collectively known as the track.
A track is a permanent way on which trains are run. Tracks usually consist of two parallel steel rails, fixed to sleepers (UK) or ties (US) which are embedded in ballast and laid in a bed.

A toy train is a toy that represents a train. It is distinguished from a model train by an emphasis on low cost and durability, rather than scale modeling. A toy train can be as simple as a pull toy that does not even run on track, or it might be operated by clockwork or a battery. Most scales are smaller than the commonly used model railroading scales. The most popular scales are O scale and HO scale.
